com.dlsc.flexgantt.model.gantt

Interface ISpreadsheet

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Spreadsheet

    public interface ISpreadsheet
    The interface required by any object that wants to be added as a spreadsheet to the Gantt chart.
    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Dirk Lemmermann
    See Also:
    Spreadsheet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getCellWidth()
      The required width of the spreadsheet cells.
      Class getDefaultValueType()
      Returns the default object type of the spreadsheet's cell values, where a cell is defined by its tree node, the spreadsheet itself, and a time span.
      IGranularity getGranularity()
      Returns the time granularity used by the spreadsheet, e.g.
      String getName()
      The name of the spreadsheet as it will be shown in the UI components that control the visibility of the spreadsheets.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        The name of the spreadsheet as it will be shown in the UI components that control the visibility of the spreadsheets.
        Returns:
        the spreadsheet name.
        Since:
        2.1

      • getGranularity

        IGranularity getGranularity()
        Returns the time granularity used by the spreadsheet, e.g. DAYS.
        Returns:
        the time granularity used by the spreadsheet. Each cell represents this granularity.
        Since:
        2.1

      • getCellWidth

        int getCellWidth()
        The required width of the spreadsheet cells. All cells have the same width. The width will be applied to the granularity shown in the dateline.
        Returns:
        the width of each cell in a spreadsheet
        Since:
        2.1

      • getDefaultValueType

        Class getDefaultValueType()
        Returns the default object type of the spreadsheet's cell values, where a cell is defined by its tree node, the spreadsheet itself, and a time span. The default value type is required when a SpreadsheetLayer tries to lookup an editor for a specific spreadsheet cell and the cell does not have a value, yet. If a value exists, then the value's type will be used to lookup an editor.
        Returns:
        the default type of the cell values
        Since:
        2.1
